result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby Joe Grady was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 5/18/2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge imposed.
Consecutive. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. This case is concurrent with 21cm1231 and CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bobby Joe Grady

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bobby Joe Grady in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Bobby Joe Grady in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court with 21CM1231.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 1: 
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instruction/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
*
Sentencing proceeded on 21CM1231 & 22CM773.  Sentencing statements heard.
As to 21CM1231:
Court ordered defendant to serve 74 days in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE, with 74 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
As to 22CM773:
Court ordered defendant to serve 48 days in the House of Correction with 48 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. This case is concurrent with 21CM1231 and CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 5/18/2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed
At SPD Fuentes request the 5/18/2022 bail bond hearing at 8:30 am is amended to a plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 37 on 5/18/2022 at 10:00 am   vk

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Bobby Joe Grady not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
Court in receipt of Defense motion to modify bail. Defense advises the Court they would also be asking for a plea and sentencing date. 
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 37.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
to Modify Bail, received and filed
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save at 1735 W Silver Spring Dr, Glendale, WI
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Bobby Joe Grady in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Bobby Joe Grady in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bobby Joe Grady appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case retabbed to Branch 37 Lower number cases pending.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
